title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering a noncontact right leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery with 1.8% odds

title: Giannis open to exploring best fits outside Bucks

title: Canes strike late for G4 win, shove Caps to brink

title: Cristobal: QB Beck cleared for summer workouts
content: Miami coach Mario Cristobal said Monday that quarterback Carson Beck has been cleared to participate in all team summer activities following elbow surgery last year.

title: NCAA prez is open to Trump's idea of commission

title: Browns' JOK out for season due to '24 neck injury
content: The Browns have placed linebacker Jeremiah Owusu-Koramoah on the reserve/physically unable to perform list, meaning he will miss the entire 2025 season.

title: Chiefs superfan gets 32 years for Okla. robbery
content: Chiefs superfan Xaviar Babudar was sentenced in an Oklahoma courtroom Monday to 32 years in prison, two and a half years after authorities caught him in the state as he fled from a local bank robbery.

title: Sources: Alonso close to being named Madrid boss

title: 2 Indian Students Killed In US Car Crash, Consulate In Touch With Families
content: Two Indian students have died in a road accident in Lancaster County, United States, last week. The victims, identified as 23-year-old Saurav Prabhakar and 20-year-old Manav Patel, were students at Cleveland State University in Ohio.

title: "Safety In Mind": Air India, IndiGo Cancel Flights To 7 Cities Today
content: These airports are among those that were reopened for civilian flights on Monday after being temporarily shut amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

content: Wall Street stocks finished solidly higher Monday, cheering an announcement that the United States and China sharply de-escalated a trade war that has rattled global markets.

content: At a serious military briefing, one doesn't expect high literature and text from epics to be quoted by a battle-hardened air warrior to drive home a point.

content: The United States announced new sanctions Monday against Iran over its nuclear program, despite ongoing negotiations between the two countries over the sensitive issue.

title: Air India Announces Flight Cancellations For Today Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Air India on Tuesday announced the cancellation of two-way flight operations to and from Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, Bhuj, Jamnagar, Chandigarh and Rajkot for Tuesday.

title: Hollywood Stars Condemn Gaza "Genocide" On Eve Of Cannes Festival

title: In PM Modi's Takedown Of Pakistan, A Mention Of Bahawalpur, Muridke "Terror Universities"

content: Following trade talks in Geneva, in which the United States and China agreed to withdraw reciprocal tariffs for an initial 90-day period, US President Donald Trump described the outcome as a "total reset" in relations with China.

title: "Could've Been A Bad Nuke War," Claims Trump. What PM Modi Said Shortly After
content: Donald Trump has taken credit for having "stopped a nuclear conflict - a bad one" in the brink of time. Both India and Pakistan have "lots of nuclear weapons", said the US President, adding that the two nations were going at it "hot and heavy".

content: The West Bank has remained under Israeli military occupation after it was seized during the 1967 Six-Day War.

content: The US military has spent more than $21 million on flights to deport migrants from the United States during President Donald Trump's second term, according to figures released Monday.

content: "The Buddha is smiling," was the code message flashed to former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi when India successfully detonated its first nuclear bomb at the Pokhran Test Range in Rajasthan on May 18, 1974.

title: Operation Sindoor: Armed forces used wide range of space assets, both Indian and foreign
content: During Operation Sindoor, Indian armed forces utilized a range of domestic and international space assets, including Cartosat and Risat satellites, alongside commercial data from Maxar. ISRO facilitated repeatable data and plans to launch EOS-09 or Risat-1B on May 18, enhancing surveillance with all-weather, high-resolution imagery.

title: 'Dance of the Hillary': Guard your data, cops warn of Pak virus onslaught
content: Indian intelligence agencies have discovered a Pakistan-linked cyber-attack campaign, distributing malware named 'Dance of the Hillary' through social media platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook. This malware, spread via video or document files, steals sensitive user data and enables remote device control. Punjab Police issued a cyber alert, urging vigilance against suspicious links to protect personal and national security.

title: EXCLUSIVE: 'There's only one Tendulkar and there's only one Kohli'
content: In an exclusive interview with Timesofindia.com, former South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher goes down memory lane and recollects the time he shared the dressing room with a young Virat Kohli during his three-year stint with the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) from 2008-10. The former gloveman revealed how he helped Kohli hone his technique against short-pitched bowling and explained why his eagerness to learn and aggressive mindset laid the foundation for his stellar career.

title: Air India cancels flight operations at 8 locations; issues advisory
content: Air India and Indigo have announced the cancellation of flight operations to and from several locations, including Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, and Chandigarh, for today, May 13th. This decision was made in light of recent developments and with passenger safety as the top priority. Air India is closely monitoring the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: CA gives major update on players unwilling to return to India for IPL
content: The Indian Premier League is set to resume on May 17. Cricket Australia is backing players who opt out due to safety concerns. The World Test Championship final is approaching soon. Several key Australian players are involved. Coaches and commentators are also considering their return. The IPL's resumption will be closely monitored for both cricket and player safety.

title: Kohli's Ranji coach drops bombshell: 'He was preparing for England Tests'
content: Virat Kohli's recent Test retirement shocked the cricketing world, including his former coach Sarandeep Singh, who revealed Kohli was actively preparing for the upcoming England series and showed no prior indications of stepping down. Singh mentioned Kohli's eagerness to replicate his 2018 success in England, making his sudden exit unexpected, especially with the crucial Test series against England approaching.

title: Apple rolls out iOS 18.5 update: News features, how to download and more
content: Apple has released iOS 18.5, introducing enhancements before the iOS 19 announcement. The update brings improvements to Mail with an 'All Mail' inbox and quick contact photo toggling. Parental controls are enhanced with Screen Time passcode notifications. Satellite connectivity expands to iPhone 13, and Apple TV purchases are now supported on third-party devices, along with a new Pride wallpaper.

title: Virat Kohli memes break internet as fans speculate on his ODI retirement
content: Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement has sparked a frenzy of reactions online, with fans sharing tributes and speculations about his ODI future. Having already retired from T20s, it's widely assumed the 2027 Cricket World Cup could be his last appearance. His coach, Rajkumar Sharma, lauded Kohli's Test career and hopes for ODI success.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying CDSL and Indian Bank. CDSL, with a buy range of Rs 1290-1270, targets Rs 1378, having broken a downward trend. Indian Bank, buy range Rs 570-580, aims for Rs 615, supported by its 40-day moving average.

title: 'He'll be there to ... ': Kohli's childhood coach's 2027 ODI WC prediction
content: Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, lauded Kohli's remarkable Test career following his unexpected retirement. Sharma expressed pride in Kohli's contributions and voiced optimism for his continued commitment to ODI cricket. He hopes Kohli will lead India to victory in the 2027 ICC ODI World Cup, anticipating another glorious chapter in his career.

title: Bill Gates' ex-wife opens up on his plan to give away wealth: 'Think it's...'
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: Trump cites 'racial discrimination' as first batch of white SA refugees land in US
content: In a controversial move, the Trump administration granted refugee status to 49 white South Africans, mostly Afrikaners, citing racial persecution. Welcomed by US officials, President Trump defended the decision, alleging a "genocide" against white farmers, a claim South Africa vehemently denies. Critics highlight the contradiction with Trump's restrictive immigration policies, while allies like Elon Musk support his concerns.

title: Two Indian students killed in fatal road accident in Pennsylvania
content: Two Indian students from Cleveland State University tragically died in a car crash on the Pennsylvania Turnpike in Lancaster County. Saurav Prabhakar, 23, and Manav Patel, 20, were pronounced dead at the scene due to multiple traumatic injuries after their vehicle left the roadway and struck a tree and bridge.

title: If hit by terror, reply won‚Äôt differentiate between govt sponsor & masterminds: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning to Pakistan, urging them to dismantle "terror universities" for their own survival, following India's successful Operation Sindoor. Modi emphasized India's military superiority and resolve against terrorism, asserting that any talks with Pakistan would only address terrorism and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: 'Lowest price in the world‚Äô: How Trump plans to cut drug costs by 80%
content: Donald Trump's executive order aims to drastically cut US prescription drug prices, aligning them with the lowest prices in developed nations. Pharmaceutical companies face a 30-day window to voluntarily comply or face potential regulatory actions. The order targets intermediaries and promotes drug importation from countries like Canada.

title: Raid 2 box office Day 12: Ajay Devgn starrer hits Rs 125 crore mark
content: Ajay Devgn's Raid 2 has achieved remarkable success at the Indian box office, accumulating over Rs 125 crore within 12 days. Despite a slight dip on its second Monday, the film benefited from the Buddha Purnima holiday and maintained a steady performance. The film's worldwide gross is approaching Rs 170 crore, with strong contributions from international markets.

title: Fear can be unlearned‚Äîand this hormone can be the key
content: A recent MIT study in mice reveals dopamine's crucial role in fear extinction. Researchers discovered that dopamine activates specific neurons in the amygdala, linked to reward, which drives the unlearning of fear. This suggests that overcoming fear isn't just suppression but a positive learning process, potentially opening new avenues for treating anxiety and PTSD.

title: Who was Rakesh Poojary? Comedian who passed away at age of 34
content: Karnataka's beloved comedian, Rakesh Poojary, tragically passed away at 33 due to a heart attack on May 11. He collapsed at a friend's mehendi event and was immediately hospitalized. Known for his work on 'Comedy Khiladigalu,' where he was a runner-up in 2018 and winner in 2020, Rakesh also starred in films like 'Pailwaan' and several Tulu movies.

title: 'Our favourite you': Dwyane Wade pens heartfelt words for Gabrielle Union
content: Dwyane Wade celebrated Gabrielle Union on Mother's Day with heartfelt Instagram posts, showcasing their love and family bond. Union, deeply touched, reposted the messages with emotional emojis. Amidst Wade's health recovery and raising their daughter, Union also shared her experiences with racism in Hollywood, highlighting the challenges she faced regarding beauty standards and opportunities.

title: AIIMS Bhopal student in city for cultural fest found dead in AFMC hostel‚Äôs washroom
content: An AIIMS Bhopal student was discovered dead in an AFMC hostel washroom in Pune, with a stab wound. He was attending a cultural festival and had missed his bus back home. Police are investigating the possibility of suicide, noting the student's history of depression and a message indicating he was 'fed up with life'. A knife was found near the body, and authorities are awaiting further investigation.

title: IPL 2025 new schedule: Check venues, timings, date & fixtures
content: The BCCI has officially announced the updated schedule for IPL 2025. The tournament is set to resume on May 17, with the final scheduled for June 3, as per the revised plan. Following extensive consultations with government authorities, security agencies, and key stakeholders, the Board has decided to move ahead with the remainder of the season.

title: 'If Thomson don't get ya...': How India's air defence system repelled Pak attack
content: India showcased its robust air defence capabilities, effectively countering Pakistani aerial attacks with a sophisticated, multi-layered system. The Indian military displayed evidence of successful strikes on Pakistani airbases, emphasizing the precision and impact of the Indian Air Force's operations. Indigenous systems like the Akash missile played a crucial role, highlighting India's growing self-reliance in defence technology.

title: Madrid crisis deepens as Vini Jr. injury confirmed
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave real madrid at the end of the season to take charge of the brazilian national team . ancelotti has been diagnosed with a sprain in his left ankle, the club said . he will take charge from may 26 when the laLiga season concludes .

title: Takeaways: Knicks take a commanding 3-1 lead
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers took a 2-0 lead over the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the team will now head to Boston with the Knicks up 3-1 in the series and looking to close it out on Wednesday .
